results.title: Diplomacy and deceit
results.creator_credit: Per-Eric Hawthorn, Peter Morgan and Independent Television News (GB)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Best of Lateline”.
Provides students with the inside story of how the Western powers failed to stop the conflict in the Balkans. Key political figures reveal what happened behind the scenes. It examines the continuing communist influence in what was once an Eastern Bloc country, the failure of diplomacy to end the conflict and the absence of Western military intervention.

results.title: Peege
results.creator_credit: Randal Kleiser, David Knapp, Leonard S. Berman, Bedford Productions and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: A family visits their grandmother, who is in a nursing home, on Christmas Day. Peege, as they call their grandmother, is nearly blind and her mental and physical capacities are failing. Through a number of flashbacks the eldest grandson remembers her as she was when he was a child - full of vitality and laughter. When the others leave he talks to her of the old times, and breaks through her isolation. Cast includes Bruce Davison, Jeanette Nolan, William Shallert, Barry Livingston, David Alan Bailey, Barbara Rush.

results.title: Dirt [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Michael Covert, Trace Fraim, Kirk Hassig, Trudi Callon and Canned Pictures
results.brief_description: Two daft Texan brothers, Scooter and Junior, are left bereft and domestically helpless when their dear old Ma dies. They hatch a plan to get a woman to replace her, searching strip bars, and even approaching a prostitute to fulfil the role. When these attempts fail they kidnap DeDe (Tara Chocol), who, due to the sadistic nature of her marriage, decides to stay with them. After DeDe’s husband, a Texas Ranger, burns their house down, the brothers rob banks to support the burgeoning family. Junior, who has emotional problems, falls for DeDe whilst Scooter forms an attraction to a bank teller, Margaret, at a local branch they frequent. “Dirt” is a black comedy and farce that apes the style and energy of a Coen brothers’ film (in particular Raising Arizona) but screenwriter, director and star Michael Covert fails to achieve the same distinctly outlandish tone. Despite some slyly inspired moments, and witty one-liners, Covert ultimately opts for conventional narrative outcomes over his subversive intentions. The film trots out a slew of familiar Texan movie cliches (bigoted and corrupt police, violent husbands, dim-witted simple folk) whilst amid all the darkly themed humour, it attempts to make some salient points about the futility of male violence. Also stars Tracy Fraim, Patrick Warburton and Olivia Rosewood.

results.title: Dinosaurs: the terrible lizards
results.creator_credit: Wah Chang and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description: Uses special effects and models to recreate the age of the dinosaurs. Gives an overview of what they looked like, what they ate, and how they lived and died. Suitable for lower and upper primary levels.

results.title: Dinosaurs: fun, facts and fantasy
results.creator_credit: Clive Doig, Malcolm Craddock and Picture Palace Productions
results.brief_description: This informative and entertaining program is a mixture of puppets, songs, animated models, drawings, old film footage and dramatised sequences, and it will answer everything you ever wanted to know about dinosaurs.

results.title: Peach's Australia : Mount Buffalo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Peach’s Australia”.
It is the position of Mt Buffalo, standing apart from the Victorian Alps, and its extraordinary shape, that have led it to being called Australia’s grandest, wildest, most novel and most romantic mountain.

results.title: Dinosaur
results.creator_credit: Eric Leighton, Ralph Zondag, Pam Marsden and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Computer animated feature from Walt Disney Pictures, artfully combined live action backgrounds with CGI pre-historic beasts. This family oriented adventure movie is about an orphaned dinosaur raised by lemurs. Years later when the inhabitants flee the continent, Aladar, as he is known, encounters his own kind for the first time. The landmark animation of this feature was highly praised for its attention to detail and awe-inspiring aesthetics. Features the voices of D.B. Sweeney, Alfre Woodard, Ossie Davis, Max Casella, Hayden Panettiere, and Sam Wright.

results.title: Dinosaur
results.creator_credit: Eric Leighton, Ralph Zondag, Pam Marsden and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Lavish Disney family movie, “Dinosaur” broke new ground with its awe-inspiring aesthetics of computer animation, set against live action backgrounds. The simplistic story is pure Disney - Aladar is an iguanodon snatched by a pterodactyl whilst still in the egg; the egg, via a range of predators and mishaps, makes a treacherous journey across land and sea until a clan of lemurs adopt the baby as one of their own; when a meteor shower rattles the inhabitants of the continent, they decide to flee; en route, Aladar experiences life with his own kind for the first time. The film entertains a gentle, traditional family brand of humour that supports the themes of compassion, friendship and tolerance with a gentle nod toward respecting one’s elders. The predictable narrative progression, a conventional quest that supports a basic morality of good triumphing over evil, is overcome by the impressive animation and stupendous set pieces.

results.title: Peach's Australia : Hahndorf
results.creator_credit: Bill Steller, Alan Bateman and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Peach’s Australia”.
Traces the history of the town of Hahndorf, South Australia, beginning with the German settlers who arrived at Port Misery (Port Adelaide) in 1838. Outlines their reasons for leaving Germany, the establishment of Klemzig, the movement of some Germans into the Adelaide Hills and the difficulties they encountered. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Peach's Australia : Murray Riverboats
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Peach’s Australia”.
The Murray River has many problems, including pollution, the dwindling of its native fish, and the introduction of the European Carp, but the biggest problem has been in the threatened loss of its history. To Bill Peach, “the riverboats represent the most colourful and romantic part of that history, and the skeletons of riverboats are symbols of our failure to love and care for our greatest river. Written and presented by Bill Peach.
